meanings.def: to kill somebody, especially as a legal punishment
examples: be executed (for something) He was executed for treason.
be executed by something The prisoners were executed by firing squad.
innocent people who are wrongly executed
He was ultimately executed by lethal injection on June 11, 2001.

meanings.def: to do a piece of work, perform a duty, put a plan into action, etc.
examples: They drew up and executed a plan to reduce fuel consumption.
The crime was very cleverly executed.
Check that the computer has executed your commands.
I swear that I will faithfully execute the office of President of the United States.
a carefully executed and well-presented study

meanings.def: to successfully perform an action or movement that requires skill
examples: The pilot executed a perfect landing.
The second goal was superbly executed.
The album contains beautifully executed songs such as ‘Can't Explain’.
The show was cleverly conceived and splendidly executed.
a series of perfectly executed pirouettes

meanings.def: to make or produce a work of art
examples: Picasso also executed several landscapes at Horta de San Juan.

meanings.def: to follow the instructions in a legal document; to make a document legally acceptable
examples: His will was executed by his lawyers in 2008.
The agreement had been duly executed.
